question: Carl goes to the store to buy some flour. The normal brand of flour he buys costs $9 per kg. He had to buy a more expensive brand that costs 10% more since his favorite brand was sold out. He decides to buy a week's worth of flour and he uses 3 kg of flour per day. He also decided to buy himself a cookie for $2. How much did everything cost?
answer:
The flour he bought was 9*0.1=$<<9*0.1=0>>0 more expensive per kg than what he normally buys
So it cost 9+0=$<<9+0=9>>9 per kg
He goes through 3*7=<<3*7=21>>21 kgs of flour a week
So he paid 9.9*21=$<<9.9*21=207>>207 on flour
That means his total bill was 207+2=$<<207+2=209>>209
#### 209
